mods.abstract: Committed To the Jail in the city of Shreveport, Parish of Caddo, a negro man who calls his name Solomon, of black complexion ; aged about thirty-five years ; about six feet high ; says he belongs to A. McClure, Smith county, near Tyler, Texas. Also negro man who calls his name Bill of black color ; aged about twenty-five years; about six feet high ; says he belongs to Wilson Owns, near Waxahatchie Ellis county, Texas. The owner or owners of said negroes ar ehereby notified to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take them away or they will be disposed of as the law directs. J.W. MAHLE, Jailor. Sept 6-tf]
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
